pullRequest.body:
Add a definition `List.Triwise`, for a predicate on a list determined by a predicate on triples of distinct elements.

This is intended in particular for geometrical properties such as betweenness, and was originally suggested by YaÃ«l in 2021: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/116395-maths/topic/circular.20predicate (definition adapated from there for Lean 4, and some API added).

There is undoubtedly lots more API that could be added, but what I have here is sufficient for at least one geometrical use case: defining a list of points being weakly in order on a line and proving that this definition is equivalent to the list of points being the image under a `lineMap` of an ordered list of values in the underlying field.


---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

### PR summary [68903cd9de](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21936/commits/68903cd9de41f06e947e8c755adcb92dad5f9096)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.List.Triwise` (new file)|36|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Triwise`
`+ Triwise.imp`
`+ Triwise.map`
`+ Triwise.of_map`
`+ triwise_cons`
`+ triwise_iff_getElem`
`+ triwise_map`
`+ triwise_pair`
`+ triwise_singleton`
`+ triwise_triple`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Added `triwise_iff_getElem` as requested (named by analogy to `pairwise_iff_getElem`).

Woah, that's ancient. Thank you for reviving!

Do you think you could prove that this is equivalent to the titular definition in terms of ordered triples of indices? Something like
```
lemma triwise_iff_forall_get :
  l.triwise p â â i j k, i < j â j < k â p l[i] l[j] l[k]
```

Woah, that's ancient. Thank you for reviving!

Do you think you could prove that this is equivalent to the titular definition in terms of ordered triples of indices? Something like
```
lemma triwise_iff_forall_get :
  l.triwise p â â i j k, i < j â j < k â p l[i] l[j] l[k]
```

If you do
```suggestion
@[mk_iff]
inductive Triwise (p : Î± â Î± â Î± â Prop) : List Î± â Prop
```

... then you should be able to do
```suggestion
lemma triwise_cons : (a :: l).Triwise p â l.Pairwise (p a) â§ l.Triwise p := by
  simp [triwise_iff]
```
This suggested proof doesn't actually work.

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/List/Triwise): `List.Triwise`
